definition: band/belt/girdle/ribbon/tire/area/zone/region/CL:條|条[tiao2]/to wear/to carry/to take along/to bear (i.e. to have)/to lead/to bring/to look after/to raise

sentences.english: A band worn around the head.
Sweat pants, hair tied, chillin with no makeup on.
sentences.chinese: 長運動褲，髮帶，不化妝的放鬆。

sentences.english: The wind shall blow my top-knot off.
It never obeys barrettes or bands.
sentences.chinese: 它從來不聽髮夾和髮帶的話。

sentences.english: Sometimes people don't recognize you without the headband.
sentences.chinese: 你摘了髮帶會有人認不出你來。

sentences.english: Plz refer to actual photo, Hair band is different from model pict.
sentences.chinese: 請參考實物照片，髮帶是不同的。

sentences.english: The width as well as the color of the headband will have a great impact on your look.
sentences.chinese: 不同的髮帶寬度和顏色會有不同的效果。

sentences.english: The most visionary accessory designers send these stylish headbands down the market.
sentences.chinese: 最有遠見的配件設計師把這些款式的髮帶推向了市場。

sentences.english: Long hair should comb up, hair clips and ribbon should not colorful.
sentences.chinese: 長髮須盤起來，髮帶髮夾顏色不可過於亮麗。

sentences.english: On the other hand you can wear it as you do the traditional headbands for a classy impression.
sentences.chinese: 另一方面，你也可以用傳統的髮帶營造優雅的形象。

sentences.english: Play is restarted with an indirect free-kick taken from where the hairband was thrown.
sentences.chinese: 在丟髮帶的地點以間接任意球重新開始比賽。

definition: cloth head covering worn by men in ancient times/headscarf (typically worn by women)/kerchief/turban
